{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.00330v1", "title": "A topological constraint on clean Lagrangian intersections from
  $\mathbb{Q}$-valued augmentations", "summary": "For a knot $K$ in $\mathbb{R}^3$, consider its conormal bundle $L_K$ in
$T^*\mathbb{R}^3$. We prove that if $K$ is the connected sum $K' \# 3_1$ of an
arbitrary knot $K'$ and the trefoil knot $3_1$ (or its mirror), then there is
no compactly supported Hamiltonian diffeomorphism $\varphi$ on
$T^*\mathbb{R}^3$ such that $\varphi(L_K)$ and the zero section $\mathbb{R}^3$
intersect cleanly along the unknot in $\mathbb{R}^3$. For the proof, we utilize
the knot DGA, whose homology was proved to be isomorphic to the knot contact
homology by Ekholm, Etnyre, Ng and Sullivan, with coefficients in
$\mathbb{Z}[\lambda^{\pm},\mu^{\pm},U^{\pm}]$. We discover a certain algebraic
constraint imposed on any augmentation of the knot DGA of $K = K'\# 3_1$ to a
field $\mathbf{k}$. This constraint is non-trivial for $\mathbf{k}=\mathbb{Q}$
and plays a key role in the proof, but trivial if $\mathbf{k}$ is quadratically
closed or if an augmentation factors through the knot DGA with coefficients in
$\mathbb{Z}[\lambda^{\pm},\mu^{\pm}]$ obtained by setting $U=1$.", "main_category": "math.SG", "categories": "math.SG,math.GT", "published": "2025-05-01T05:58:44Z"}
